thread.title: iPad Pro aims for the corporate market
thread.title_full: iPad Pro aims for the corporate market

title: iPad Pro aims for the corporate market
text:
Apple CEO Tim Cook introduces the new iPad Pro. (Photo: Monica Davey, EPA)
31 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE SAN FRANCISCO — Apple unveiled the iPad Pro, a much larger tablet aimed at the corporate market.
Apple which has been struggling with slowing sales of iPads is hoping to appeal to enterprises with a device with a larger 12.9 inch screen, a keyboard and a stylus that Apple is calling a "pencil."
The iPad Pro will be available for $799 (32GB/Wi-Fi), $949 (128GB/Wi-Fi) and $1,049 (128GB/Wi-Fi + Cellular) starting in November, just in time for the all-important holiday shopping season. The keyboard is extra.
Apple CEO Tim Cook called it "the biggest news in iPad since the iPad." USA TODAY
Apple partners with Cisco to focus on business clients
USA TODAY
Apple’s (Big) Blue-print for enterprise
Apple brought Microsoft's Kirk Konigsbauer on stage to demonstrate how Office apps would work on the iPad Pro. Office for iPad will be optimized for the iPad Pro's larger screen. And Microsoft Office will support Apple's new stylus.
The iPad Pro is Apple's latest bid for the corporate market, potentially bringing with it a whole new set of iPad customers who could help stem the decline in tablet sales. "Pro" doesn't just describe the device, it also defines the customers Apple is targeting.
A video for the iPad shown at the Apple event in San Francisco said the new iPad "allows you to be more productive and creative."
31 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN //usat.ly/1EVuz1e TOP VIDEOS
